MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!TEMPLE OF THE VOIC.dialogue_text: "It will gnaw away at your Trueflesh in absolute silence! You will soon be good company for that arrogant Uraklian!"

A.dest_add: MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!TEMPLE OF THE VOICE!3.0010!CAITO!

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!RUINS OF URUGH!0.0.dialogue_text: And as such, my feet to ancient Urugh shift, or at least, to what remains of it. A desolate city, whole swaths of it remarkably untouched by the cruel and indiscriminate hands of Brother Time, yet still it stands as lifeless as the wastes surrounding it.\n\n        As if a demon summoned by the thought of its name, the wastes wheeze their foul breath at my back, kicking up spiraling clouds of dust. The spirals dance toward the open gate - unwanted guides urging on a reluctant visitor. Remembering all too well what awaits, these feet still walk those fateful steps across the threshold.

The gates, imposing, domineering, stare derisively as Biracul's humble servant enters. These sinful towers call to memory another Kavan feature, brothers torn apart by an ancient calamity. So similar in make, yet so utterly contrasting in magnitude are they, these abhorrent Gates of Awakening and that wicked Vanquished relic called the Gate of Celestial Judgment. Indeed, as Brother Mountain is to a common boulder, so too is this gate to that of the Tambulans; even inviting comparison almost seems undue.

Though ominous it may be, a now dead gate is as powerless as the dead who built it. Yes, it cannot bar my passage! It will not stop His plan! Now all it can do is rot and crumble as its sinful makers did!

But no cause has Biracul's humble servant to linger on matters long settled. The foolish Vanquished punishment received, forgotten are, and soon shall completely disappear. His will demands it and his servants obey!

Duty calls the Trueflesh back to its pursuit. Thus is my Self returned to the present - to its current present. As my mind's eye scans the hazy horizons of memory, to the north a massive fountain appears, shimmering green in a dying afternoon sun. Taller than the hawk can fly, louder than the desert winds, sweeter than the Spring's new flowers, it blocks out all else, as though some perceptual storm blinding all awareness. Waters cascade down its emerald flanks from heights unseen, hidden in a thick fog of their own making. It alone is alive and well in this lifeless city, a skyward-crawling vine among a pile of bones.

But the spell soon breaks, when eyes fall upon the tragic stones atop a hill northeast. Those gorgeous white pillars, all so carefully arranged in tightening circles... Tears well up and overflow - a mirror of the living fountain. Does it also weep? If so, hope compels that it remembers why... long now has my Self forgotten the reason for its own tears at this sight. But sure as Brother Sun does rise, so too do these tears fall whenever I chance upon the stone circle...
Standing there in silent contemplation, this humble servant simply waits. Searching for sound guidance. For the Voice.

A.response_text: Head north toward the massive emerald fountain

B.response_text: Head northeast to the Stone Circle

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!RUINS OF URUGH!0.X.dialogue_text: Feet drift as though upon a river's current toward the emerald font, destination ever drawing nearer...

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!RUINS OF URUGH!0.0.dialogue_text: It is then my Self steps into the decaying shell of a once proud structure. The gray light of the Wasteland sky filters through gaping holes in a high-vaulted ceiling, illuminating motes of dust as they swirl like snowflakes in a windless fall.\n\n\t\tBut the path is known to me now, as it was to me then. It is now and ever has been as it should be. A descent into the waterways, and a final birth from its canals await.

C.response_text: Look around

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!RUINS OF URUGH!0.0.dialogue_text: This place... it may once have mirrored the entrance hall at the city's origin. Alcoves line the walls where statues once stood - where partially misshapen stumps of rock now stand. Awareness calls like distant thunder as the mind counts the statues. Their number coincides with the number of Thiudan Blood-Drinkers... Eyes stare unbidden, searing those abominable, half-eroded visages forever into memory. These were the Masters of the Vanquishers! The malcontents who crushed humanity under the weight of their avarice! Their faces, into my Trueflesh burned, have never been forgotten.

Though with dread filled, my eyes remain unaverted, transfixed upon the twisted countenances of Mother's enemies. Staring ever more intensely, until it feels as though the statues will reach out from the past to corrupt the very essence of my present.

Stumbling, my form collapses at the edge of the font. The soothing sound of water crashing heals wounds unseen. This, the sole piece of Mother still allowed within this prison of man. Its call renews focus, casting the haze of recollection back into sharp relief.
Now clear to see is the hatch leading down into the waterways of ancient Urugh, behind the emerald font. Yet, my Self awaits Its command before recklessly rushing in where ghosts fear tread.

C.response_text: Descend into the waterways

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!RUINS OF URUGH!0.0.dialogue_text: And back to the font feet drift, as though riding Sister River's flow. The destination, none but the undesired company of the grotesque statues laid ruin by Mother's hand - a fit punishment for the hubris of the belly-slithering Blood-Drinkers of Thiuda...
The hatch into the waterways of ancient Urugh remains. Yet, my Self still awaits Its command before recklessly rushing in where ghosts fear tread.

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!RUINS OF URUGH!0.X.dialogue_text: Through these forlorn and forgotten streets feet shift. To the spiraling Glyph of the Stone Circle, my Trueflesh is directed.

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!RUINS OF URUGH!0.0.dialogue_text: The massive blocks here, though unmistakably wrought by man's hand, emit a rare air of Mother's touch - almost as if they were naturally eroded sculptures, perfected by Brother Time's chisel. Arranged in what looks to be concentric circles, ever tightening, they center upon the bone-white husk of a dead tree.

Standing among the ancient stones, no sickening and unholy resonance with the damned Vanquished ails me. Odd, as it is these heathens whose tools must have once crafted this place. Greater still my confusion grows when an intense pull from the dizzying labyrinth of lines upon the circle's floor begins to overwhelms the Trueflesh. An unmistakable connection with the Shining One seems to flow through my very core!
Though with it, a connection both undeniable and ineffable in equal parts remains, clarity of its purpose yet eludes me...

From this site eyes see the path leading here as well as the emerald font at the forked path's end. Yet some other seemingly innocuous sight catches the mind. Beyond this hill, the crumbling red bricks of structure abide...

A.response_text: Head west to the massive emerald font

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!RUINS OF URUGH!0.0.dialogue_text: To the Stone Circle my form returns and the connection with the Shining One pours to the forefront of memory. Yet as hazy as youthful memory is, it remains incomplete, and fragmented as the coppery, fallen bricks of the nearby structure.

A.response_text: Head west to the massive emerald font

B.response_text: Go back to inspect the crumbling remains

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!RUINS OF URUGH!0.X.dialogue_text: The crumbling reddish sandstone now returns to the dust whence it came. Ancient beyond measure, this place has not the stains of a Vanquished hand. The fallen bricks outline the walls a once imposing tower. Its contents... only absence, a darkened pit, bottomless at best estimates - though, this still somehow fails to convey its true depth. An erasure so thorough its original existence now seems just a forgotten tale.\n\n\t\tBut whatever the tragic fate of this tower may have been, all is as it should be.

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!RUINS OF URUGH!0.0.dialogue_text: The city's veins, fittingly filled with the filth of man even after all this time, its stench warns of their unnatural birth. Yet down the ladder descending and into the tubes vanishing my Self goes. His will be done. All is as it should be.\n\n\t\tBut surprise awaits halfway down, where the rungs give way to corrosion and my body falls into a pile of refuse, soft with rot. Clear as Summer's sky this is the final task of Biracul's Eidos, return no longer possible. Weakness of the Falseflesh conjures emotions of fear and regret. Strength of the True dispels them.

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!RUINS OF URUGH!0.X.dialogue_text: Thus my form arises and wanders, awaiting a sign in the darkness of this corpse's veins. The echoes of faint trickle of water demand attention. Massive, amplified artificially by the tube. Tracing a foot along the floor, it seems a crack beneath grants escape to the city's lifeblood. Perhaps it will thus meet its demise! The wretched bastard child hemorrhaging the filth its wicked fathers imbued in it!

C.response_text: Keep moving forward

E.response_text: Widen the crack to hasten the process

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!RUINS OF URUGH!0.0.dialogue_text: Thus my form arises and wanders, awaiting a sign in the darkness of this corpse's veins. The echoes of faint trickle of water demand attention. Massive, amplified artificially by the tube. Tracing a foot along the floor, it seems a crack beneath grants escape to the city's lifeblood...

Without warning, my form moves. As of habit, pounding fists and stomping feet splinter, pulverize and otherwise erase from existence the fissure, sending it into the realm of memory. Below this vein, another layer holds. Yet the damage is done and Brother Time will surely finish Biracul's work.

With no tools to use but those which Mother gifted, my Self resolves to widen the crack. Pounding fists and stomping feet splinter, pulverize and otherwise erase from existence the fissure, casting it deep into the realm of memory. However, below this vein, another layer holds, tenuously shielding the echoing cavern beneath it. Yet the damage is done and Brother Time will surely finish Biracul's work...

Suddenly, passionate waves of Awareness wash over the mind. A connection to He whose Voice rings through me... Yes! Benevolent Biracul's hand must too have touched this forsaken prison of man! Was He preparing the journey's path? Hope compels me to believe it so! Such thoughts warm my ghost to the core!

As the Voice commands, the Flesh obeys! Onward into the darkness of the unknown! Blindly stumbling, with none but faith as trusted guide, feet drive me ever forward. Though the trek soon ends upon collision with a portal, sealed through some weakened magic. A dead end..? Or...

Recollection eludes the mind... Brother Time leaves none untouched. As His feet in solemn march step absently upon our carefully crafted sandcastles, so too do His fingers smudge the ink of Memory as it dries.\n\n\t\tClear as cloudless skies did my Self past the portal travel, yet how it was accomplished... certainty to mystery returns. All is as it should be.

The spiral stairwell thus reached, deeper into the bowels of the structure my form plunges. Deeper, deeper, ever-deeper. Converging to where my long-sought prize lies in restless slumber! The Thought Wheel of the Beginning, the Birthplace of the All-Seer!

Passing through ghostly portals - here now, then gone - feet drift among the chambers in utter darkness. Floating in the shade, the eyes soon bathe in eldritch light. Not far ahead, the floor yawns, vomiting a ghoulish glow through the shattered teeth of its gaping maw. Peering down its throat, eyes now see into its empty belly; long has it gone hungry. But today it breaks the fast, swallowing my form as it leaps to the room below.

A resonant slap of feet echoes sharply through the lengthy hall. Here nearly all space is occupied by blasphemous works of artifice - poison to the mind! Five profane thrones of silver curse the chamber. Arranged around a shining, circular seal, each faces inward and toward the others. A closer look at the thrones soon reveals the charred shadows of figures burned onto the smooth metal seats. What diabolical misdeeds were done in this unholy space?! A question perhaps best left unasked.

C.response_text: Examine the Farcaster seal

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!RUINS OF URUGH!0.0.dialogue_text: Eyes wander, soon falling upon a break in the eight walls, upon a window peering out into a gargantuan cavern. The area's luminescence springs from the unnatural emerald sludge coating the cavern walls.\n\n\t\tBut the cavern holds secrets far more profane, far more wicked than this! Five spheres of darkness absolute hover mid-air, staring out like a corpse's sightless eyes. Oh, curse those wretched, truth-blind eyes of the Blood-Drinkers! When they gazed upon the Empyrean, the All-Seer must have burned brilliantly, casting eternal shadows on the arrogant fools who came uninvited!

C.response_text: Examine the seal the thrones surround

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!RUINS OF URUGH!0.0.dialogue_text: The more the eyes fixate upon the dark orbs, the more abhorrent they become! Rage fills the heart at the mere sight of them! Silent and unmoving, they are the utter absence of form, holes pierced into the very fabric of space...
The blasphemous mockery of His Eye!
Fools! What could possibly compare?!
Not these forbidden geometries!
Not these irreverent, child's toys!
You Blood-Drinkers needed five to even glimpse what He sees with one!
And what becomes of those who play God when they meet Him?
Ha ha! Yes! What have you to say now, Blood-Drinkers?!
The only remedy for hubris is the bitter draught of death! And now you have drunk your fill!
All is as it should be!

A.response_text: Examine the seal the thrones surround

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!RUINS OF URUGH!0.X.dialogue_text: The seal... Yes, the seal! Memories of the Empyrean now flood my thoughts, the All-Seer's warm embrace, the unbounded ecstasy of the holy mission entrusted to me!

C.response_text: Step upon the seal

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!RUINS OF URUGH!0.0.dialogue_text: Then a sudden revelation instills in me the need to record some parting words... A loosened stone my pen, the Shining One my muse, and out flow the words that will be my last on this seemingly interminable journey...

SUCCESS! THE ORIGIN OF THE MONAD FOUND IS!
		DEMONS THE VANQUISHED WERE IF SUCH A THOUGHT WHEEL HERE TURNS,
		A COUNTER WHEEL IN RESPONSE TO THE REVOLUTION OF OUR WORLD.
		LIES THE EMPYREAN BEYOND THIS PLANE?
		CERTAINTY ELUDES MY KEN.
		ALONE HERE STANDING, PAST AND FUTURE BEYOND RECKONING.
		WHATEVER HERE NOW OCCURS, GLADLY THE SIN I SHALL BEAR.
		I, TORMA, HAVE BEEN. WITNESS ME.

Thought to word translated, as incomplete as essence to thought first rendered... An emptiness my Trueflesh had always felt in trying to express both in thought and word the sublime nature of my Biraculian connection to the Monad, to the name my Trueflesh now dares to utter...
To Conscientia.

Thus named, thus to word transformed, all potency of its essence evanesces, like a moth finally attaining the flame. For though words may possess strong magic, nothing compares to the essence from which their power flows!
My mission near completion, perhaps no longer will the mind need the conceit of thought or word...
Perhaps 'I' can simply 'be'...
The seal... Yes, the seal! Memories of the Empyrean now flood my thoughts, the All-Seer's warm embrace, the unbounded ecstasy of the holy mission entrusted to me!
Gifting one final glance to those fateful words my hand once etched into the stony floor so long ago, my Self once more steps upon the Farcaster seal.

A lifetime of travel and searching, a lifetime of dedication and servitude... The culmination of His plan. It is finally upon us! Whatever deeds you demand of my Trueflesh now, willingly are they done! A foot upon the seal, soon accompanied by its twin, the Thought Wheel begins to spin, its activation signaling the fulfillment of my oath.
All is as it should be.
Then again, never could it have been otherwise.

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!0.000!DE.dialogue_text: ...A hand reaches towards my form, grasping firmly, pulling me into the present. The hand soon grows a form, the wise and loyal Vovkos, most singularly devout of all the Monad's servants. Among the glassy sands of the Kavan wastes, we head east, ever east... Though the eye be lost in an infinity of sand, the mind is as compass, pointing only east toward the Stilled Sand Crater.

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!0.0000!D.dialogue_text: Feet mark the sand, speaking of our presence. Yet Uncle Wind laughs loudly, hot breath blowing sand back into our tracks. Mother's family eventually erases all signs of our time here, a necessary destruction of the old to invite the new.

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!0.0001!D.dialogue_text: Countless negated steps carry us to the crater's time-worn entrance, to that blackened sea of absence. Air ripples with the hot afterbirth of Hel's genesis - that spawn of unspeakable terror, the unmaker of what should be. Many were the sins of the Blood-Drinkers, but her creation chief among them. For her creation means the destruction of all else...

D.response_text: Run away

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!0.001!DE.dialogue_text: As the Voice commands, so do we obey! Recklessly we descend, into the jaws of madness. The chaos below eyes us with interest and desire in equal measure, tugging roughly at our Trueflesh, and slowly chipping away at our essence. Each step closer to it seems to melt a fraction of the Self, threatening to sever our link to the All-Seer. Even still, faith in the Shining One compels us! In His light no darkness can abide!

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!0.X0010!.dialogue_text: Sudden movement draws the eye. The crater's ebon skin now crawls with pearlescent pustules, writhing in agony, taking on some demonic form. Blood-Drinkers' spawn! Deniers of Truth! They are all the Monad is not! Wicked mirrors relaying shadows! The absence of all Self!

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!0.0011!D.dialogue_text: Sudden movement draws the eye. The crater's ebon skin now crawls with pearlescent pustules, writhing in agony, taking on some demonic form. Blood-Drinkers' spawn! Deniers of Truth! They are all the Monad is not! Wicked mirrors relaying shadows! The absence of all Self! The...\n\n\t\tOdd... From the depths of memory, a forgotten Glyph resonates. Its throbbing pulse whispers... thoughts... no, words! Words begging communion...

C.response_text: Ignore the call

D.response_text: __Use the Glyph of the Occult__

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!0.0012!D.dialogue_text: A flash of Awareness acts as summons to the current present. Roused from ecstasy and delivered into terror, eyes witness the pulsating river of filth shift its flow in our direction. Fear grips the form, compelling flight from duty, escape from whatever madness lurks below. Vovkos gives chase. Yet soon does he fade into the dust of unremembered events.

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!0.00120!.dialogue_text: Feet work unbidden, their panicked retreat carrying my form north, far from the wicked pit. Space is a blur, until at last my Self ascends a glassy dune, capped with the calcified husk of a Vanquished warbeast. Here the safety of solitude awaits. Even in Danger's den, Biracul offers shelter.

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!0.0013!D.dialogue_text: Yes, this place is... unsettling. The heart's unspoken fears, its silent cries, ring truly in His ears! Biracul urges retreat! Willingly the Self would have descended into chaos, yet this He does not demand. Faith steadfast, the tranquil peace of safety is my reward!

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!0.002!DE.dialogue_text: Reaching the warbeast's worn carapace, my Self pauses in a moment of silent contemplation. Here yet another finger upon the hand of the All-Seer moved the world...

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!0.0021!D.dialogue_text: A journey by the All-Seer commanded then, just as mine is now. His name fades into the shadows of forget, his deeds along with it. How long before my fate converges with his? What markers will my Self leave to likewise be forgotten..?

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!0.X0022!.dialogue_text: None will remember Torma... Of course... Torma never existed to begin with! A mere fragment of the Unit! A finger unaware it is of the hand! The hand forgetting it works at the mind's behest!

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!0.0023!D.dialogue_text: When all have forgotten Torma, when history no longer whispers the name, only then can my Self truly rejoin the Self! A return to the Eternal Spiral! That is faith's reward!

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!0.00200!.dialogue_text: Without warning, a strange sensations bubbles up from within memory. The emotional tug of Wulfias...

C.response_text: Acquiesce to the pull

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!0.00201!.dialogue_text: As the Voice commands, so does this servant obey. Strong the pull may be, but stronger is faith! The mind is a storm at sea, waves breaking, crashing, drowning out all thought. Faith are my chains! Bound is my Self to His will! Safe in His restraints, the waves cannot carry me to sea!

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!0.00210!.dialogue_text: As the Voice commands, so does this servant obey. Strong the pull may be, but stronger is faith! The mind is a storm at sea, waves breaking, crashing, drowning out all thought. Faith are my chains! Bound is my Self to His will! Tied to the sacrificial altar, the surging waters and bellowing winds strip the Trueflesh from the mind, carrying it off into the infinite. Awareness wanes as slumber falls upon the Falseflesh like the Final Night. All is as it should be...

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!0.003!DE.dialogue_text: Just then, as if to wake me from a sleepless dream, Vovkos up the dune strides my name carried on the wind of his voice. Wordlessly he soothes me with his fatherly hand, into his embrace drawing. Tears cut through our dust-caked faces...

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!0.0030!D.dialogue_text: Memory compresses Time forcing it into unnatural folds. What may have once taken half day's lengthy sunlight, now simply needs epiphany's instantaneous flash. The beginning of forget is to remember.

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!0.0031!D.dialogue_text: Is this the Shining One's mercy or His punishment? Does He keep us from the pain of the unremembered? Or is sin relived in perpetuity?

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!0.0032!D.dialogue_text: But answers would be meaningless - for how could an ant understand the will of man, much less a man the will of the Monad!

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!0.0033!D.dialogue_text: Distant eyes peer into mine, pleading words issued through silent lips. Vovkos summons me back to the Wastes. Our journey continues.

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!0.0034!D.dialogue_text: Divine intervention my flight must have been, as to the Salt Forest it leads. White crystal pillars sprout forth from the edge of the abyssal crater, spaced with the exact precision of soldiers marching to their early grave. From crater lip to cliff's edge these withering warriors glow crimson in Brother Sun's dying light, silently awaiting an inevitable doom. Yet their despair is oddly comforting, as Brother Death lives among us and not among the Blood-Drinkers. He comes as guide, taking us to our forgotten family in the Eternal Spiral. A far cry is Death from the oblivion Hel promises...

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!0.0035!D.dialogue_text: We are safe, for now, from the unnatural magics of forsaken wizards, safe among these dying pillars. Here we will not be undone. Here the pit of absence holds no sway.

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!0.004!DE.dialogue_text: Yet, the wastes offer no true solace to the weary traveler.

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!0.0040!D.dialogue_text: A thunderous crack acts as prelude to a pillar's fall. Vovkos moves again his silent lips, barking commands, unheard, unheeded. So he is cast in shadow, his eyes freezing upon the thing that would stand in light's way. Head turning, dread returning, eyes fall upon the fiend. Bigger than the beast of the Vedt twice over, a towering colossus stares down at us with ruby eyes burning brightly. Its form is some perverse mutation of crystals opaque and otherwise. Dark obsidian acts as armor, shielding powerful amethysts beneath.

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!0.0041!D.dialogue_text: And in the space of a thought, the strength that fell a pillar comes crashing down towards our frail Falsefleshes...

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!0.0042!D.dialogue_text: When eyes next open to vision blurred, Vovkos kneels over me, forlorn face nearly hidden in the intercourse of dust and sand permeating the air. Now red streams flow where tears once did back in the Vedt - an eternity ago, it seems. But even though this moment lasts only an instant, his face tells me what his unspoken words never could...

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!0.0043!D.dialogue_text: We will not meet again in the Eternal Spiral.

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!0.0044!D.dialogue_text: With a nod of parting, he steps into the light, Falseflesh burning brighter than any crystal ever could! His thought draws circles in the sand, lines ricocheting within their bounds. With each new edge part of Vovkos and his crystalline foe shattered, spiraling toward their common center, fusing into some dark, unholy brew. When all is done and the light wanes, shadows return to the ancient forest.

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!0.0045!D.dialogue_text: A sacrifice he will make endless times, the ultimate sacrifice...

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!0.0046!D.dialogue_text: Never again can his Self rejoin the Spiral.

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!0.005!DE.dialogue_text: The wind whistles through the pillars, mocking my pain. Though, Mother often warns not to dwell on loss at length, lest we make of it an lasting companion.

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!0.0050!D.dialogue_text: Eyes fall one last time on the abomination, the fruit of forbidden Techne. Never could this be changed, not the first time, not the myriad times since. Never will it be forgotten, not now, not the thousand times hence!

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!0.0051!D.dialogue_text: His love is great; His love is cruel! His love is all we need! And all is as it should be!

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!1.X000!D.dialogue_text: Ripples unfold across the scene in shimmering waves. Something haunts me from among the shadows. The Memory-Thief... His presence now so strong... His chilling breath pours down my neck like a waterfall of mephitic vapors. The eyes turn to look, but he has already melted back into the shadows. Soon, he is gone and all fades with him, back into nothing, back into the Void...

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!1.000!DE.dialogue_text: Ripples unfold across the scene in shimmering waves. Something haunts me from among the shadows. The Memory-Thief... His presence now so strong... His chilling breath pours down my neck like a waterfall of mephitic vapors. The eyes turn to look, but he has already melted back into the shadows... and into the shadows, as if by instinct, my Self follows...

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!1.5010!D.dialogue_text: What trick of Hamlik is this?

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!1.5011!D.dialogue_text: His fiendish squawking disguised as the Voice!

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!1.5012!D.dialogue_text: Deception! Lies! From behind his rubied mask!

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!1.5013!D.dialogue_text: Shining One! Free your servant from this monster's grip! Save her from the Blood-Drinker's ploys!

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!1.5016!D.dialogue_text: The Glyph burns cobalt circles into the Trueflesh, lines and curves copulate within. Unholy light seeps through them, a most sinful mist along with it. A deep and murky indigo shrouds the summoned evil.

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!1.510!DE.dialogue_text: The grotesque, pearlescent legions let out a howl of exaltation, signaling the pact between them and their new Jinnwraith. Having been thus accepted by my new charges, I stride across the void field of the blackened crater and emerge from its depth, the ravening host of the pit at my back.

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!1.511!DE.dialogue_text: Hosting silent Hel within my shell, I seek to ease the pain of my misguided flock. Once their mage, I failed to protect them from themselves, from ambition, from the evil within...

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!1.512!DE.dialogue_text: From the adversary... from the 'Shining One'...

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!1.513!DE.dialogue_text: Living is pain; existing is suffering! That great hypocrite Biracul promotes life, promotes agony!

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!1.514!DE.dialogue_text: To what end?! What is life but fodder for death?!

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!1.515!DE.dialogue_text: His words will poison my flock's pure ears no more! No longer will it tangle their thoughts, nor taint their natures! Our silent cycle of anguish ends now! I will free my little birds from the weight of being!

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!1.516!DE.dialogue_text: No phoenix will rise from the ashes I leave! I will salt these lands, giving a destruction most thorough!

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!1.517!DE.dialogue_text: The Sun Tower will be first... A symbol of the victory my people will achieve in annihilation. The point begets the circle and the circle the sphere! Come! Come forth from the depths of the Graylands twisted sister and deny existence!

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!1.518!DE.dialogue_text: Oh, the light does shine, blinding us from Truth! Shining One, do you seek the blindness of ignorance for your sheep? I seek the clarity of Hel's Void!

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!1.519!DE.dialogue_text: Soon my northless birds will all find peace! Yes! Finally! All will truly be as it should be!

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!1.520!DE.dialogue_text: This tower crumbles; our Truefleshes are unmade; we walk together into the Final Night!

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!1.521!DE.dialogue_text: Draugnir! Yours is true freedom! Your Trueflesh has melted from the False! You are forever without pain, forever without strife! March! Share your gift with them! Show them the mercy of oblivion!

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!1.522!DE.dialogue_text: Yes! ...The bridge... The path to salvation. I come for you, my lost family. I will guide you home!

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!1.523!DE.dialogue_text: ...Ark... Come to help me free the people? Yes, together we can... Wait, what are you saying? I do this for you! For the well-being of these little birds! I seek to restore their freedom. Please! You must understand!

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!1.524!DE.dialogue_text: Please! Don't do this... not again...

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!WASTELAND!1.525!DE.dialogue_text: My heart... can no longer bear it...

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!ZHILIAN STEPPE!0.0.dialogue_text: And somehow my Self is back at the beginning, just when it seemed my dream had ended. For all did end with His creation, did it not? Yet still, habit-driven feet have carried me back to the exceeding austerity of the Zhilian steppe. I was back home.
Indeed, the place of Torma's birth. Before there was the Prophetess, the Eidos, there was only Torma, the mischievous little steppe-dweller of the Zhilian people.

Our wind-swept land punishes the meek. But make no mistake, there was no reciprocity from humans here, no battle with Mother Nature here. Just as no fool would ever hope to ensnare Brother Sun, so too do we regard Mother with singular and sacrosanct deference. Rather, the task is to gain Her respect through overcoming the harsh trials She laid before us.

Not all win Her respect in the end, but my people had for centuries endured, thus gaining Her protection. As proof, it suffices to note that not even the Blood-Drinkers dare come to these barren highlands. We lived in the only land beyond Vanquished hands.

Indeed, His creation! Biracul, though not of Mother born, was still birthed! In the crucible of the Empyrean crafted! But the Shining One is risen, and now my Self again returned to the wind-swept Zhilian steppe. Returned to a time before my awareness of the sparkling verses of Biracul... to a time before the betrayal of Awareness.

Yet memory fails, and memory dies. None but the All-Seer truly know what memory cannot recall. And if we would see through the Eye, we must use faith as lens! Clear as summer skies that work remained, and thus to Zhili my Self returns. What task awaits? The vision of my homeland surely holds the key.

The scene expanded before the eyes, off into the six directions. Feet stand upon stubborn grasses that claw their way up through chilled soil, gathering Brother Sun's bounty. Skin feels Uncle Wind as He whispers cold tales from travels to lands unknown. Eyes watch as Sister Cloud sculpted figures in the sky.\n\n\t\tSerene and pure, this place, Mother's very home, is sacred to the Eye.

However, despite the alluring verisimilitude, this is nothing but a specter of memory, a mere reflection of what once was, and no longer is. In truth, only the All-Seer can revisit what to us is past. As a shadow is to its caster, and as the caster is to the light, so are we to the All-Seer. So foreign, so far-removed, but nonetheless so inexorably linked.

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!ZHILIAN STEPPE!00..dialogue_text: And so, my Self looked upon its beginnings from its end, seen with detachment and with incontrovertible knowledge of its illusory nature. This, the closed loop of my existence. Life has become a dream - or perhaps it is only at the end that one realizes it always was.

D.response_text: I would dispel the illusions.

E.response_text: Dreams are for the weak.

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!ZHILIAN STEPPE!0.0.dialogue_text: Even so, in this realm of smoke and mirrors my Self remained. Feet shift, carrying me forward; left and right fruitlessly vie to be first, unaware that they are bound together in the end. Faster and faster they move, soon breaking into a dash. The speed peels layers of time and memory from the Falseflesh, leaving only the True behind.\n\n\t\tSummer rains chase away autumn winds, and frozen winters oust fertile springs. Over and over the cycle unwinds, returning my form to the innocent youth of its origins, to a time before knowledge tainted its core.

Admittedly, illusions would have put me ill-at-ease were it not for my bond with the Shining One. Devotion and sacrifice to the higher purpose of His creation dispelled the illusion of fear. His light banishes the specters of darkness! No illusions, no doubts can lurk in His shadowless presence!

Admittedly, the Trueflesh is willing, but the False is weak. This servant of Biracul's was but a mere human, no divinity can she reach, no apotheosis awaits her. But strength is not necessary, for my guide is the crystalline Voice of the Shining One. Enough for me is it to be touched by the hand of the divine. After all, contentment begets bliss..

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!ZHILIAN STEPPE!0.X.dialogue_text: Then, silence shatters as something rips through the space between memories... A sound, faint at first, grows ever-clearer...

D.response_text: The rapid beating of my heart.

E.response_text: My rival's lamentations.

F.response_text: A maddening cry.

C.response_text: NEU

D.response_text: SUR

E.response_text: TYR

F.response_text: LOO

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!ZHILIAN STEPPE!0.0.dialogue_text: As such, attention from present to past flows. Friends from long ago come into view, pursuing one another, spreading the Sa'Ma until all have succumbed to its corrupt effects. Yes, they play "The Spread". We play it.

Chodak had taught us that death is merely a return to Mother, that the Sa'Ma is not to be feared. It is as kin to us, birthed of Mother's womb. Just as we consume the lamb's tender flesh, so too does the Sa'Ma nourish itself of our Falseflesh. Thus, we play to remember our end is but the end of a game... And the beginning of a new one.

But children never truly see with the Eye. Impatience clouds youth's eyes to the wisdom of Awareness. A game is just a game, nothing more, nothing less. But Chodak was Biracul-sent, our candle in the shadowlands of ignorance.
How blind we were and how sightless we remain in the darkness of memory...

Uncle Chodak fades into view, reciting the Storm Scripture. He sings the history of our peoples' exodus from the lower valley of Zemes up into the highland steppe. A return to Mother Nature and a departure from the prisons of man. Those blasphemous cities with flying Cloudstones and marvels of Technocraft. So full of form; so devoid of substance.
He tells of the encroaching Sa'Ma, claiming victims who failed to see with the Eye. He sings of the Divine Storm. Of the Vanquished's demise. Man's hubris in full bloom.
Of Mother's womb to life we came and of the Unaware, this privilege she revoked...

Thought directed inwards, panic spirals beyond control as the heart rumbles like the thunder of a thousand bolts - this immaterial and illusory heart, not of the Trueflesh. Breath, chaotic, crushing perception under the oppressive weight of memory.
It matters not. No harm can befall me. For even if here sinister Hel were to claim my Trueflesh, He will persist!
Yes! The Shining One is born and all is as it should be!

A rival? Yes, those too did Torma have. Pema, the unforgiven. The boy whose daily gift was pain; the boy who taught me violence. Fists drew blood from my Falseflesh, the price demanded for some unspoken, imaginary offense...

Day after day he taught me how to harm the weak, until one day our lessons ended. A rock cast from my trembling hands met his eyes, tears and blood mixed in an intoxicating brew. Never again would those eyes see. Never again would he raise a hand against me...
Ironic that only in darkness did he gain true sight. From that day forth he saw that Torma was to be feared and respected. For who else could serve the Shining One but one such as His chosen Eidos?
In the end, the sole arbiter of truth is strength.

A resonant call fills the air, more deafening than a Blood-Drinker's cackling howl, ringing louder than the raucous call of Brother Thunder! Yet is it my mistake or do the eyes see a silhouette stained upon the clear sky of some anthropomorphic poultry? A fowl form regaining the birthright its ancestors had once left as inheritance.
In truth, this delirious and magnificent caw comes from above... A flying beast so majestic as to challenge Brother Sun for ownership of the celestial sphere!
Words emerge from the caw-cophony, whispering His arrival...
Roostor! The Feathered One!
Surely one of Biracul's many masks must this be!
Bizarre to think that spectacle had occurred. Yet now, its incontrovertible truth is known!
Time stops.

...Something lurks beyond, invisible to the eyes, but clearly present and of the present - for no past specter haunts me like this. Who or what stalks Biracul's servant on this forgotten steppe? Could it again be some Memory-Thief? Hope compels me to believe it not, as so few of my own memories remain...
Alas, it is not my place to know, else Biracul would have made the nature of this Visitor apparent. Faith's confirmation comes with the presence's disappearance. A problem no more.
Silence shatters as something rips through the space between memories... A sound, faint at first, but ever-clearer...

D.response_text: The rapid beating of my heart.

E.response_text: My rival's lamentations.

F.response_text: A maddening cry.

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!ZHILIAN STEPPE!0.0.dialogue_text: A savage tempest shatters the nostalgic spell, chasing Brother Sun into the darkness of Sister Midnight's bosom. Be it the Divine Storm returned to end its bloodfeud with humanity? Perhaps not, but how could we have known then?

All the villagers take flight, fleeing Mother's wrath towards the safety of our village, carved deep into the face of a cliff. Though She brings the storms, the cradle She provides shelters us from harm. Mother is fair and She is wise. All is as it should be.

Yet, as it was then, so it is now; my Self simply abides, motionless, wondering why the Forbidden Forest at the edge of the steppe now beckons. Oh, that grim crypt for Muninns, white trunks clawing through the soil like the unearthed bones of fallen giants... Yes, that far off grove where time and space now warp at the whim of some unknown force - another trick of memory?
Nevertheless, the wonder yet remains... Why does it so fervently demand my company..?
Unhesitatingly, my feet obey its commands and guide me towards the mist-shrouded woods.

Approaching the edge of the steppe, just as though it were the edge of the universe itself, my sanity wavers, and my form drowns in an infinite sea of trees and fog. Though, to my constant surprise, the path is clear as virgin springs...
Feet never stray, as if the knowledge of where each trail leads has been grafted upon my Trueflesh from previous forays into the Forbidden Forest.
Thus, by the grace of Biracul, my destination is clearer than cloudless skies. The Torch of Awareness illuminates the way through the misty veil, and into the depths of the forest.
Soon, feet carry me to a modest, yet imposing abode carved into the hardened flesh of two intertwining Muninns, grander than any trees my Self has ever witnessed since.

Upon arrival, memory shows the entrance open, granting access to a smoky interior. A warm, orange light keeps the gluttonous shadows at bay and reveals the presence of the Seer of the Jeran Mystics...
Uraklian.
Her name is as familiar as kin, for is my life nothing but a closed loop? Knowledge of the end pours back into the beginning, so that it may ever renew its flow...

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!ZHILIAN STEPPE!0.X.dialogue_text: But soon, memory of a voice interrupts these idle thoughts. Memory of a voice, but not the Voice...

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!ZHILIAN STEPPE!0.0.dialogue_text: Her sudden and total silence alarms me at first. Then, like rays from Brother Sun piercing stormy skies, Awareness begins to grow, casting light into the shadows... Bringing hope. Yes, this is the first time Biracul's Voice speaks through His servant, through His Eidos!

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!ZHILIAN STEPPE!0.X.dialogue_text: In essence, my Self no longer speaks, only the Voice does now. Uraklian's awe shows she understands this, beyond a shadow of a doubt - though she is never so forthcoming with her truths...

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!ZHILIAN STEPPE!0.0.dialogue_text: Kavu, the end of my voyage, the Thought Wheel of the Beginning. Though its significance remained unclear at the time, now my understanding is unclouded by the fog of ignorance. Kavu! It was, is and forever shall be my destination.

Her message conveyed, Uraklian's form disperses, slowly, until it rejoins the fragrant fumes within her abode. And just as a memory fades from consciousness leaving only fragmented thoughts in its wake, the Forbidden Forest too begins to dissipate, white trees evaporating into an ever-thinning mist. Gently disappearing until emptiness is all that remains...
"Who now darkens my doorstep? Another pretender to the title of Eidos?"
"How could it not be? But more likely it is that strength for the Wyrm this impostor will become..."

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!ZHILIAN STEPPE!1.4.dialogue_text: "Yes, I too was blinded by the mind's fire, the lust for truth... That is until I found it!"

MIND!PALACE OF MEMORY!ZHILIAN STEPPE!1.5.dialogue_text: "Then by all means, proceed onwards to Jer!"
